summary: A confidential letter to Judge Alison J. Nathan from an unnamed individual petitioning for the release of Ghislaine Maxwell on bail. The writer offers $2,000 as security, vouches for Maxwell's character, and argues that her detention conditions are extreme and that she will not flee.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom this bail support letter is addressed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the letter; the writer is petitioning for her release on bail, vouching for her character and asserting her innocence.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Bail Petition for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: An unnamed individual submits a letter to Judge Alison J. Nathan petitioning for the release of Ghislaine Maxwell on bail, offering $2,000 as security.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: An individual is petitioning Judge Alison J. Nathan for Ghislaine Maxwell's release on bail.
The writer offers $2,000 as security towards Maxwell's bail bond.
The writer asserts Maxwell is of good character, believes in her innocence, and argues her conditions of confinement are extreme.
The writer claims a social connection to Maxwell, having had lunch with her the summer before last.
The document is a confidential letter dated November 17, 2020, filed in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
